title: Food was very good -
text: Food was very good - staff very friendly - late booking on Xmas eve but was able to fit us in - We had the steak and the Chicken Burger

title: Pleasant Boxing Day
text: Visited this restaurant on Boxing Day for a family meal - very impressed - social distancing was excellent as it’s a big venue - the food was good particularly the steak pie - nice setting if you are willing to drive

title: Had a wonderful meal -
text: Had a wonderful meal - we were in the extension but we were very comfortable- staff very friendly - food excellent - will return

title: Great find
text: Thanks To Trip advisor we found this pub on the way home . The food was excellent - well presented and good size portions. The staff were friendly. Social distancing was good. Will visit again when we are passing

title: Enjoyable few drinks
text: Stopped for a few drinks - Staff were very helpful - Social distancing was excellent - order via an app and all table service- different beers and some good cocktails -

title: Great building but bad experience
text: Great building but unfortunately the rest of the experience wasn’t good. When we arrived they couldn’t find our booking ( our friends had booked ) however the staff found us a table. Some of the food came out cold and had to be re served. The service was poor as we had to continually try and catch their attention for cutlery / drinks etc. We were giving food we didn’t order and the final straw we were not allowed a dessert at 9.15 as they stopped at 9pm serving !! ( we weren’t informed) Staff were very friendly though and food average

title: Great pit stop
text: Great place to stop for a snack/ light lunch - food was fresh and staff very friendly. Location central to the quays

title: Simply Wonderful
text: Location wonderful food wonderful staff wonderful - sun was out with a lovely atmosphere snd friendly staff - strict Social distance rules enforced -

title: Great food
text: Visited this restaurant for a birthday meal - food and service was excellent - They are still offering £10 pp reduction even though the Gov scheme is finished. Menu isn’t cheap but worth it. Will visit again soon

title: Good experience
text: Last minute trip booked due to cancelling a trip abroad. Boat was old but exceptionally clean- and the handover was very good , in depth and with a bit of humour - We would recommend this company

title: Great social distancing effort
text: The food is always good but what impressed us was the effort for Covid19 - The table app worked very well and the staff were continually cleaning - Creamy mash and Rice are favourite sides

title: Nice breakfast
text: Stopped for breakfast on our first visit to Chester. The food was very good and we enjoyed the coffee/ teas. Friendly staff However social distancing was not great - seating too close

title: Food very average
text: Unfortunately the food served on the reduced menu was very average( being kind) . Whilst suitable priced and whilst understanding it’s difficult times we would have still expected better. However the staff were very friendly and it’s a great location for anyone on a barge

title: Excellent Italian food
text: We stopped on a Tuesday night and the restaurant was very busy. The food was excellent - large portions and reasonably priced- Recommend the mussels and the carbonara . staff very friendly

title: Great food
text: We stopped on our first barge adventure- staff were very friendly . The food was excellent - we had steak/lamb/burger and fish. Large portioned. Enjoyed all meals - not cheap but worth it

title: Great chilled location with friends
text: Great place to meet, drink and chill. The wine tasting is a great option but not a must- Friendly helpful staff - social distancing measures in place

title: Good food with friends
text: Very nice food - friendly service - social distancing measures in place - good for pizza and pasta dishes - excellent location and building - all 4 of us enjoyed all 3 courses
place: Wildwood Restaurant at Royal William Yard

title: Good pub food
text: Very nice pub food - very friendly staff- enjoyed our evening with friends - loads steak burger was very nice

title: Great find
text: What a lovely B&B in a great part of the city. The staff were sooooo friendly who couldn’t do enough for us. Having to order your Breakfast the night before is the only disappointment but it was nice and everything else was lovely. The permit system for parking on the road outside worked well £4per day. We will stay here again in the future.

title: Great architecture
text: It’s worth’s short trip from the town centre. Stunning architecture and a lovely park in front for a stop/ picnic

title: Worth a visit
text: Whilst there are currently several restrictions ( repair work and Covid19) it was still worth a visit - it was quite a walk from the town centre 35 mins and up a steep hill but you can catch the bus . Staff were very helpful and friendly

title: Nice atmosphere with nice wine
text: This bar is in a nice busy area with restaurants/ coffee shops etc . We stopped for a drink sat outside and ended up having a few glasses of wine with Nachos as a snack, The wine was very nice and the staff were very friendly.Seemed like a very popular place to drink

title: Great place to stop . Really
text: Great place to stop . Really friendly staff . Would recommend to anyone visiting. If you need a pit stop try here

title: Stopped for a lunchtime snack.
text: Stopped for a lunchtime snack. We had a couple of paninis which were very nice. Service was slightly slow but the food was worth the wait. Friendly staff

title: Nice pit stop
text: Stopped for a few drinks after a days shopping - nice outside seating area - staff were very friendly

title: Wonderful steakhouse
text: Second visit to this wonderful steak restaurant. You will not find many places with a better steak - delightful blue cheese butter side- the portion of French fries was large and the starter was plentifully. The staff were extremely friendly

title: We stopped in the newly extended
text: We stopped in the newly extended beer garden which appeared well set up for Covid19 - We downloaded the app and ordered our drinks - after waiting 25 mins we asked a male member of staff - He said he would check,he returned with our drinks but missed off the snacks we ordered and paid for. When we questioned this he was abrupt and wasn’t apologetic at all. We got our snacks but would expect better service. Things go wrong which we accept but at least staff could make up for it with friendly service - shame as St Agnes is a great place to visit

title: Enjoyed a very nice meal.
text: Enjoyed a very nice meal. The blue cheese lettuce wedge and pepper sauce is always very nice . We shared the Chateaubriand. Wine and champagne was good . Sticky toffee pudding for dessert

title: Got together with some friends
text: Got together with some friends for a pre Christmas gathering. Food was good and the service was excellent. It’s a great concept ( non traditional) food doesn’t come together so be aware but great way to meet, eat and catch up

title: 3 families met for Christmas
text: 3 families met for Christmas Eve ( late booking) - food was generally good for a major chain - Had a problem with one meal but exchanged without a problem - Service was excellent - very friendly -

title: We only had drinks before
text: We only had drinks before going to the cinema. The atmosphere was very lively and the decor smart - tried to book a table for after the cinema but couldn’t get the right time so will try again another time. Worth a visit

title: Amazing experience
text: We spent 7 days in a over the water villa and thoroughly enjoyed it. We didn’t use the incredible facilities ( football pitch, tennis- badminton and volleyball courts, cricket nets, golf driving range, pitch and put,jet ski, Kayaks , scuba diving) because we wanted to snorkel and chill. We swam with sharks, turtles sting rays and many many coloured fish. The food was amazing and the staff sooo friendly ( particularly Quraish Abdulla our Waiter and Hussain our room attendant) Didn’t meet a member of staff that wasn’t simply amazing . The weather wasn’t as good as we expected - several cloudy/ Rainy days - but that cant be helped. The only negative for us was the All inclusive package. It was like going back 10 years were you could only have limited drinks and if you wanted to have a better quality wine or cocktail you had to pay the full price not just the difference. On a positive note the mini bar was all included. We had one night in the speciality restaurant ( included) and the food was stunning. We couldn’t believe how empty the island appeared even though it was 97% full - Always sun beds- tables and seats in all bars and restaurants - Speed boat ride was 45 mins from Airport - Many trips available also a Spa

title: Amazing Tastes
text: The food was amazing. On all the previous visits we had the taster menu but this time we choice various dishes ourselves and WOW - Great tastes - Mixture of Sushi and meats - Staff are great - very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was buzzing for a restaurant. It is expensive but worth it

title: Not up to expectation
text: We booked a business meeting on line but when we turned up they did not have the booking. Luckily the restaurant was empty so we had a choice of tables. The food was very disappointing, one steak had been over cooked and had to be returned. The the quality of the steaks was substandard. The service was friendly enough and the view is amazing but unfortunately the food didn’t meet the standards we had previously experienced.
place: Marco Pierre White Steakhouse Bar and Grill Plymouth

title: Nice Indian Restaurant
text: We didn’t have a reservation but were accommodated. 8 of us eating. Food and service was good and we would be happy to return

title: Great Evening
text: We booked for 8 and were very happy with the food and drink. It’s quite expensive but enjoyed our evening and would recommend

title: Nice place to stop for a snack
text: We stopped for a snack - The food was nice ( club sandwich and Avocado & poached eggs) The service was very good -
place: The Brasserie at de Gruchy by Tiffin

title: Worth a visit
text: It’s a must when you visit the island for the first time - Once is enough - Focused more on the history of the invasion more than the tunnels but fascinating
place: Jersey War Tunnels - German Underground Hospital

title: Glass of Fizz
text: We didn’t eat in the restaurant but stopped for a glass of fizz on our way out of the hotel - nice atmosphere - worth a visit

title: Anniversary & Birthday weekend
text: Long weekend stay at this hotel for special celebrations. It’s fairly central with friendly staff . We had a free upgrade to a suit which was a nice touch - breakfast was nice - we didn’t use the outdoor pool or spa facilities but enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend

title: Great place to stop for a drink
text: We stopped at RYH 4 times during our weekend - Great atmosphere- lunchtime food was good - very central - great during the day or during the evening - lots of outdoor seating as well as indoor - friendly staff

title: Best way to travel
text: Great bus service - very regular and only £2 each journey- covering all the island - Can obtain a day or multiple day passes

title: Amazing tastes
text: This restaurant lived up to its reputation. Amazing food with great service - only 8 tables - it’s certainly a dining experience - not cheap but worth it

title: Nice view of the harbour
text: We stopped for our first drink of the day after walking from St Brélade- Very helpful staff and a niece view of the harbour - A very buzzy place

title: Great food - Friendly service
text:
We looked for this place as no1 on Trip
Advisor - Couldn’t find it at first as no sign but glad we persisted- very friendly and great food - Antipasto starter - special menu lobster and pork main course was amazing - great find - must visit

title: A must
text: It wouldn’t be right to visit jersey and not visit this castle - trip over in the duck and then a bit of history with a great view

title: Lovely place to eat
text: The service was excellent so friendly and helpful - The decor was lovely. The pre dinner cocktails and fizz went down well . The banjo prawns were nothing special but the goats cheese was very tasty. The monkfish scampi was nice and the lamb was very good

title: Stunning view
text: Great place to look out over London - Nice place to stop for a few drinks - Easy to spot several landmarks - a must do when visiting london on a break

title: Great way to see London
text: 6 of us had a 3 hr tour with Catherine - great way to see london - all 6 of us was very surprised what we learnt and how much we enjoyed it

title: Very pleased
text: We had a lovely couple of days - this venue has more facilities than Springs - The check in staff rushed the process but on the whole the staff were very nice . Carole Locke was particularly good in her class. Food was excellent and rooms very clean. Like most places when paying for a enclusive package you end up paying extras ie food supplements. Nice walks, plenty to do and we will be back

title: Great place for a pit stop
text: Stopped for a light bite - The BLT was fantastic- couldn’t resist some cake and ice cream to follow - worth stopping - wonderful deco

title: Soooo friendly
text: Great little site, really friendly owners , clean, tidy and very dog friendly. Total opposite to the large “Haven “ type sites. Very accommodating to ensure we had two pitches together. Some lovely little touches. Would recommend this site and are looking to book again next year

title: Great Tastes
text: Pre booked a table at this restaurant that sits right on the edge of the bay with great views- the staff we’re inflexible when we phoned to try and re arranged the time however when we arrived all the staff were very friendly - We had all small tapas dishes ( 12 between 4 of us) just about right - All the dishes tasted wonderful - we would recommend this restaurant to anyone to eat and very dog friendly

title: 2nd Visit unlucky
text: It’s the 2nd time we have visited this village pub - the 1st time we had a lovely roast but this time not so good- The service wasn’t great , forgot one set of cutlery, forgot home made tartar sauce for the fish cakes , fairly long delay in taking order, fairly long delay in serving food and generally below par service - The fish cakes were really nice but the beef wellington was tough as old “boots” - we informed the waitress but she didn’t make anything of it - On the positive the drinks and reasonably priced and it was a nice busy atmosphere

title: Lived up to its reputation
text: We enjoyed our first visit to the Watering Hole. Lovely atmosphere. Good pub grub and very dog friendly. Located right on the beach

title: Lovely place to stop
text: Great cakes and coffee. Very dog friendly. Extremely helpful and pleasant staff. Perfect place for a pit stop

title: First Visit - We will be back !!
text: It was our first visit . We went with friends who had recommended it. We had the taster menu £32 each ( min 4) It was outstanding - Great way to try all the different flavours on offer.

title: Great Sunday Roast
text: Lovely Sunday roast - Pork Beef or Combo - Friendly service - Nice location - Worth the extra costs of a Carvery

title: The wedding cake
text: Amazing building but most important is the views. Ensure you pay the extra €10 and take the lift to the top ( from the rear upper level ) amazing views all over Rome
